result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Harris

records.addlTxt:
2:31 PM Defendant Michael D Harris in court.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Court questions defendant if he wishes to have counsel represent him and he does.
Defendant states that he was not eligible for public defender representation,  but is informed to complete a new application with them to determine if he is eligible
If not eligible for a public defender then he can petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant indicates that his employer is not willing to provide a letter of termination.
Defendant is informed to let the public defender's office know this information.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 3

Do not possess/consume alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:33 PM Defendant Michael D Harris appeared by video, in custody. Assistant District Attorney ADA) Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is not   eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
